page.title: 08Gourdon Fish Family Business
page.content: Mr. Birse's business is a family one. He starts getting ready at 6.30am each working day and packs the van and cleans his scales and sets off at 8.00am. On Mondays he doesn't go out because he works in the fish house getting hotel orders ready and cleaning things. In the Spring he mostly sells{haddock,}whilst in the Summer, Autumn and Winter he mostly sells{herring and shellfish.}On average he sells 28-30 stone a day. Mr. Birse goes out in all weathers. After coming home from his round each day he spends about 1-2 hours tidying up. The{new regulations}regarding fish vans means it is necessary to have a wash-hand basin in the van and the driver's compartment must be sealed off from the back and you need a first aid kit.
